name: Oaxaca Ollin

reviews.text: While traveling from Veracruz we checked the internet for affordable places to stay in Oaxaca. TravelAdvisor listed this bed and breakfast with lots of glowing reviews and the right price. They confirmed immediately that rooms were available and asked for a credit card, we expressed our concern in doing this on the net and they took us at our word and kept the rooms for us. Just give the cab driver the address, as the name is not known and he tried to take us to the nearby Holiday Inn. We asked him to call the dispatcher that got us there after just a few turns. We were greeted with the local Jamaica Tea in the spacious entry with fountain, dining room and living room looking onto the swimming pool. Local art crafts are placed throughout, sun hats and books on loan and someone always in attendance. We needed beds for 3 adults and were provided with this wonderful major room with queen size bed, balcony overlooking the pool and the inner courtyard. Another room with single bed, sink and beautiful Mexican tile counter. Bathroom with stall shower, sink and more of the lovely tile. All the beds, tables and chairs were deeply carved with the Diego Rivera lily pattern. The breakfast with coffee or hot chocolate was very gourmet and different each day. This is located within walking distance of the famous church, museum zocola and enormous markets. We had a slow flow in the shower one afternoon but that was attended to immediately. Taxi service arranged for you on demand. Wonderful beds. A few critters making night noises but the human activity very quiet. The air conditioned airport was only a 15 minute ride on Saturday morning. Small, efficient, on time with a nice deli and pitchers of orange juice and local coffee, and a few lovely museum pieces. Smaller planes you are led to on the tarmac. An hour to Mexico City with drink service.
reviews.title: Absolutely as advertised.

likes.liked: — Beautifully decorated, clean, friendly, good breakfast and all services.
likes.disliked: — Night noises from dogs, roosters and 6:30 AM church bells.

reviews.title: The personal touch
reviews.text: Staying at Casa Ollin was a high point of ur Oaxaca trip. Our room was clean, airy and comfortable, overlooking a small pool, and with a very usable terrace.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Each morning started with a breakfast (served between 8 and 10 A.M.) consisting of coffee or hot chocolate, juice, pan dulce (wonderful variety of bread), fresh fruit and a genuine Mexican main course. We had a different, enjoyable main course each of our 7 breakfasts. Upon returning from a warm day of touring we were also greeted by a cool fruit drink.
reviews.title: Delightful accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jon's mantra at Casa Ollin is "another day in paradise", and generally it was. Jon and Judith are knowledgable and helpful in planning side trips, advising of restaurants, arranging cooking school classes, or helping with flight reservations. The Casa also has available books and information which will aid you in daily planning.
reviews.title: A Warm Welcome

likes.disliked: — There was nothing to not like

reviews.text: Casa Ollin is a relaxed operation; the employees are treated like family (and some of them ARE family) and respond accordingly.
reviews.title: Absolutely Loved the Ollin

reviews.text: We stayed at Casa Ollin during Semana Santa and loved every moment in this friendly B&B. It's a quiet haven away from the bustling center of Oaxaca, the rooms are beautiful and very clean and the staff as well as the owners Jon and Judith are exceedingly friendly.
reviews.title: A very happy time at Casa Ollin

likes.liked: — staff, rooms, breakfast, library and location

reviews.text: I spent many siesta hours reading house library books on local customs, history, cooking, crafts and art, which made our excursions all the more enjoyable. Our daughter meanwhile enjoyed the pool and the juice that were so kindly served to her when she was drying off.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Casa Ollin

reviews.text: I know that Casa Ollin breakfasts have been mentioned by many other reviewers and rightly so: they are outstanding and still make me sigh wistfully! Sitting around the table with other guests just added to the pleasure.
reviews.title: We'll be back!

reviews.text: I would also like to mention that we (and other guests) received precious help in recuperating our luggage lost by Mexicana.
reviews.title: What a nice place, staff is absolutely great

likes.liked: — The very nice, clean rooms and the amazing staff

reviews.title: A Magical Experience
reviews.text: We hope to visit Oaxaca again soon and would most certainly stay at Casa Ollin again, can't imagine a better place.

reviews.title: Beautiful Days Now At Oaxaca Ollin
reviews.text: Stayed nearly three weeks at Oaxaca Ollin and hated to leave this home away from home. From hosts Jon and Judith to other staff members, this place is more welcoming than any place I have stayed in my Mexico travels of the past 17 years. Very comfortable rooms, lovely new pool, fine little library with excellent books on Oaxaca and Mexico, and delicious breakfasts every morning! Beautiful days now in Oaxaca, and location of Oaxaca Ollin an easy walk to every site I wanted to visit in the city. Stayed here in February of 2006 and this time loved it even more. My highest recommendation!

reviews.title: Excellent experience
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from Mexico and during our trip we spent 11 nights at this wonderful B&B "Oaxaca Ollin". Jon, Judith and their staff do a superb job of making you feel very welcome. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed with beautiful linens and small touches like fresh flowers. We would not hesitate to recommend Oaxaca Ollin to anyone.

reviews.title: Que bueno!
reviews.text: This bed and breakfast is a must. I recently stayed there with my wife and found it so friendly and accomodating, I've been telling everyone how great it was. The owners make you feel like family and can help you out to find the real sights and sounds of oaxaca. Their food is excellent and very authentic. I've travelled all over mexico and Ollin of Oaxaca is as good as it gets.

My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at Casa Ollin from January 6th to 13th, 2007. Jon and Judith were wonderful hosts and they and all of their staff made sure our stay in Oaxaca was one to fondly remember. The rooms were immaculate and very comforable and spacious. Breakfast in the morning was always a treat as we got got sample Sofie's cooking - some of the best in Oaxaca in our opinion. Jon and Judith provided excellent advice on restaurants and provided valuable insights for our tours through the Valley of Oaxaca. With their guidance we were able to visit the workshops of some of the finest indigenous artisans in the Valley. On our next visit to Oaxaca, my wife and I will definitely be returning to Casa Ollin.
reviews.title: Home Away from Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my husband wanted a unique honeymoon, we went through oaxaca then cancun and on to costa rica. I contacted Jon and Judith via email to book a room for the stay in Oaxaca, unfortuneatly the timing was not great and we were caught up in the unrest that this beautiful place has been experiencing, but in all honesty we would still consider the stay a highlight of our 7 week honeymoon even though we had to leave early...... the owners and staff of this gorgeous bed and breakfast are top of the range!!!!! they will treat you like longtime friends but still respect your privacy. The meals we were eating every morning were local to the area and i must say I have been dreaming of the food ever since!!! When the truoble became worse they made sure we got out safely and have even stayed in touch since. The room was huge and the bed was comfy and a king, location wise it is fantastic, only a 5 min walk into the Zocalo, which personally i would not want to stay to close to anyway. The staff are amazing and above all else the price was great value, jon is fluent in spanish and Judith is fluent in english so that was also a benefit for 2 aussies stuggling with the language. We will definately make the long journey back there and would only ever be stying at the Ollin!!!
reviews.title: like staying with friends..only better

likes.liked: — the people the location the food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned Friday from Oaxaca. We stayed at the Oaxaca Ollin B&B and had a wonderful experience! Our hosts and their staff made us feel so welcome and were always available to help. I had chosen this inn because of the great reviews and I have to add our voices. Because of the "difficulties" in Oaxaca we wanted to stay somewhere that could help if we needed it. We never encountered any scary situations, although we were there during Revolutionary Day Nov. 20, when there were some protests but we were out touring the countryside so only heard about it from the staff. Our experience was a completely positive one and I urge travelers to visit Oaxaca, such a wonderfully friendly and charming place. The breakfasts at Ollin were different oaxacan specialties every day, served to us by Sophie, a wonderful cook and the hosts, John and/or Judith, always were available to help us with suggestions for planning our days. All in all we were very, very pleased.
reviews.title: Wonderful Thanksgiving in Oaxaca

likes.liked: — friendliness and service of owners and staff

reviews.title: A life we could get used to
reviews.text: In February 2006, my daughter and I stayed at Oaxaca Ollin and have only the highest praises for its accommodations. We are going back in February 2007. The owners, Judith Reyes and Jon McKinley, were warm and friendly, and exceptionally helpful with any plans that we wanted to make. Sofi, the cook, served the most scrumptious breakfasts, prepared while we ate fresh fruit and bakery items and drank fresh fruit juice. The rooms were nicely decorated and as neat and clean as any 5-star hotel, perhaps cleaner. The B&B is attractive with a homey atmosphere. My only regret is that we were unable to stay more than a week. It´s the kind of life we could get accustomed to very easily. We highly recommend it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent five days at the Oaxaca Ollin and only wish it had been twenty-five. Our room was lovely, quiet and clean and Sofia's breakfasts were phenominal. Jon and Judith were terrific hosts, helping us organize day-trips and offering great suggestions for places to see and eat in the city. The entire staff was warm, friendly and helpful. Also, you can't ask for a better location. Museums, markets, shopping and great restaurants are all within easy strolling distance. Oaxaca is a gem of a city and the Casa Ollin is a gem of a B&B. And, don't forget to try the house mezcal - it's one of the best!
reviews.title: Terrific hosts, great location, wonderful city

reviews.text: A friend and I had the pleasure of staying at Oaxaca Ollin for about a week in June. I spent a week riding around Mexico and this B&B was a vacation within a vacation. First of all the place is immaculate, and just stunning to look at. The pool and rooms are at a level any hotel in the states should strive for. The morning breakfasts were out of this world, beyond words, nothing I can type would do them justice.
reviews.title: Better than my home away from home

reviews.text: The real bonus of the hotel was Jon, Judith and the whole staff there. It really has a family atmosphere. One day I got a little bit of stomach flu and hung out by the pool all day. The staff treated me like a sick family member. Offering me advice and remedies and especially this tea, which succeeded where Imodium AD failed.

description: Ollin Features Mexican gourmet breakfast, Multilingual Staff, Upgraded beds and linen, Library. New -- computer with high speed connection available for guest use -- also available WiFi connection. Swimming Pool, Three outdoor patios to choose from. All rooms non-smoking. Assistance with all of your sightseeing needs. Free local calls, Free long distance calls to the United States. Laundry service available. Medical services on call. Roof Top Terrace.
